Enum XmlDatatype

The basic data types recognized by IndexingStrategy.

Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public enum XmlDatatype
Remarks

Note that if KeyType is set to Presence, then XmlDatatype must be set to None.

Fields

Name Description
Base64Binary

Base64-encoded arbitrary binary data.
Boolean

Binary-valued logic legal literals {true,false,0,1}.
Date

Calendar date. Format: CCYY-MM-DD.
DateTime

Specific instance of time. ISO 8601 extended format: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
DayTimeDuration

A duration of time. ISO 8601 of extended format PnYn MnDTnH nMn S.
Decimal

Arbitrary precision decimal numbers. Sign omitted, “+” is assumed. Leading and trailing zeros are optional. If the fractional part is zero, the period and following zero(es) can be omitted.
Double

Double-precision 64-bit floating point type - legal literals {0, -0, INF, -INF and NaN}. For example: -1E4, 12.78e-2, 12 and INF.
Duration

A duration of time, in ISO 8601 extended format PnYn MnDTnH nMn S.
Float

32-bit floating point type - legal literals {0, -0,INF, -INF and NaN}. Example: -1E4, 1267.43233E12, 12.78e-2, 12 and INF.
GDay

Gregorian day. For example, a day such as the 5th of the month is --05.
GMonth

Gregorian month. For example: the month of May is expressed as --05--.
GMonthDay

Gregorian specific day in a month. For example, Feb 5 is expressed as --02-05.
GYear

Gregorian calendar year. For example, for year 1999 write: 1999.
GYearMonth

Specific Gregorian month and year. For example, to express May 1999 write: 1999-05.
HexBinary

Arbitrary hex-encoded binary data. For example, 0FB7 is a hex encoding for 16-bit int 4023 (binary 111110110111).
Integer

Integer type. Note: This data type maps to Untyped Atomic in the Berkeley DB XML library.
None

No XML data type.
String

Character strings in XML.
Time

An instant of time that recurs every day. For example, 1:20 pm for Eastern Standard Time, which is 5 hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), would be 13:20:00-05:00.
UntypedAtomic

An arbitrary, generic data type that can be used as other types.
YearMonthDuration

A year month duration derived from Duration in the format PnYnM. For example, to indicate a year month duration of 2 years and 3 months, you would write: P2Y3M.
See Also
IndexValueSyntax
IndexingStrategy
